rationale: No intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifies a risk-adjective.
The segment reports a case factually ('first time a patient... has tested positive') without high-potency framing.
Neutral language used; 'has tested positive' is factual reporting.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
This segment reports a fact (first case without typical exposure) and lacks explicit calming language.
The segment does not contain a minimiser used in conjunction with a scale contrast.
The segment contains a bare negation 'did not work with any poultry or dairy farms' without an explicit calming cue.
